thread.title: 'Harry Potter' actor Matthew Lewis helps 200 kids visit Orlando theme parks
thread.title_full: 'Harry Potter' actor Matthew Lewis helps 200 kids visit Orlando theme parks | Examiner.com

author: Janelle Sheetz
title: 'Harry Potter' actor Matthew Lewis helps 200 kids visit Orlando theme parks
text:
Play 'Harry Potter' actor Matthew Lewis helps 200 kids visit Orlando theme parks Press Association Helping others isn't just a common theme in the " Harry Potter " books--its a value demonstrated regularly through the series' fans and even the films' actors, most recently Neville Longbottom himself, Matthew Lewis.
Lewis helped 200 kids enjoy the "holiday of a lifetime" as the British Airways charity flight Dreamflight jet set out on its annual trip, this time for a 10-day trip headed to Orlando. The children will visit multiple Orlando attractions, including SeaWorld, Disney World, and Universal Studios--which will, of course, include a visit to the Wizarding World of Harry Potter.
"I read about what Dreamflight was and how amazing it was going to be for these kids that I jumped at the chance to be here," Lewis said in a video interview. "It's been the most amazing day, it's been a pleasure."
The children were personally chosen by doctors and medical experts due to the struggles with serious illness, disability, and trauma and were accompanied by about 100 doctors, nurses, and physiotherapists.
"Some of these kids are so buzzing, and it just warms your heart so much to see their faces," Lewis said.
More than 5,000 children have enjoyed Dreamflight trips since it was started in 1987.
